title: Swæfheard
text:
Swæfheard was a <a href="king">king</a> of <a href="Kingdom_of_Kent">Kent</a>, reigning jointly with <a href="Oswine%20of%20Kent">Oswine</a>, <a href="Wihtred%20of%20Kent">Wihtred</a>, and possibly <a href="Sw%C3%A6fberht">Swæfberht</a>.
Swæfheard's charter <a href="http%3A//www.anglo-saxons.net/hwaet/%3Fdo%3Dseek%26amp%3Bquery%3DS%2B10"></a> dated 1 March 689, in the second year of his reign, identifies his father as <a href="S%C3%A6bbi%20of%20Essex">Sæbbi</a>, King of Essex ("ac consensu patris mei Sebbe regis"). He witnessed two charters of <a href="Oswine%20of%20Kent">Oswine</a> <a href="http%3A//www.anglo-saxons.net/hwaet/%3Fdo%3Dseek%26amp%3Bquery%3DS%2B13"></a><a href="http%3A//www.anglo-saxons.net/hwaet/%3Fdo%3Dseek%26amp%3Bquery%3DS%2B14"></a>, one of which is dated 27 January 690. He was still reigning jointly with Withred in July 692, according to Bede.
